workshops.prompt: Create class Vehicle(vin) with read-only property vin. Subclass Truck(Vehicle) with capacity (int). __repr__ should return 'Truck(VIN, capacity=...)'.

approaches.title: Traditional OOP
approaches.description: Use standard class inheritance with @property decorator

approaches.title: AOP: Audit Logging
approaches.description: Use Aspect-Oriented Programming with a decorator to log method calls for debugging and auditing
hints: Hint 1: In audit decorator, print f'[AUDIT] {self.__class__.__name__}.{fn.__name__} called'
Hint 2: After fn() returns, print f'[AUDIT] {self.__class__.__name__}.{fn.__name__} completed'
Hint 3: In Truck.__init__, call super().__init__(vin) and set self.capacity = capacity.

workshops.title: classmethod vs staticmethod
workshops.prompt: Implement class Counter with: (a) class attribute total=0; (b) classmethod from_list(lst) that returns sum(lst); (c) staticmethod is_positive(x) -> bool.

approaches.title: AOP: Memoization Cache
approaches.description: Use Aspect-Oriented Programming with a decorator to cache expensive function results
hints: Hint 1: In memoize, check 'if args in cache: return cache[args]'
Hint 2: Otherwise, compute 'result = fn(*args)', then 'cache[args] = result' and return result.
Hint 3: from_list should return sum(lst), is_positive should return x > 0.
